q1.question: What is Flow-XR?
q1.answer: Flow-XR is a digital platform that provides visual tools for coaches and therapists to work with their clients and for individuals to take self-reflection and personal development sessions

q2.question: How does it work for coaches and therapists?
q2.answer: Simply log in to your account and choose the method you work with. Share the link with your client and experience the real-time shared board.

q3.question: Is it suitable for beginners?
q3.answer: Yes! With its intuitive interface Flow-XR is designed to be used with ease and without any need of special training.

q4.question: Can I use it with mobile?
q4.answer: For Yourself as individual you can work with your mobile. However the nature of sessions with coaches or therapists require desktop.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal data when you use our web application ("Flow-XR"), which provides AI-assisted coaching sessions focused on personal development, spirituality, leadership, and related fields.
privacyPolicy.commitment: We are committed to protecting your privacy and complying with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.

section1.title: 1. Data Controller
section1.content: The controller of your personal data is:
section1.footer: If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Policy or your personal data, please contact us at the email address above.

section2.title: 2. Categories of Personal Data We Collect
section2.content: We process the following categories of personal data:
items: Account information (for logged-in users): name, email address, User ID.
Session data: session timestamps, your responses, notes, and chat transcripts generated during coaching sessions, used solely to provide session history and continuity.
Feedback and ratings: any feedback or ratings you provide within the App.

Technical data (collected by hosting provider DigitalOcean): IP address, request timestamps, HTTP status codes, request paths, browser type, and operating system. These logs are used for security and operational purposes and are retained for approximately 7 days.

OAuth data: when you log in via Google OAuth, we receive limited information (such as your Google account email and name) to authenticate your identity. Authenticated users are identified by their Google Account ID, provided by Google during the OAuth authentication process. We do not create, modify, or control this identifier.

Guest user data: guest users receive a temporary identifier generated in their browser, consisting of a timestamp and random string (e.g., guest-1234567890-abc123). This ID is stored in your browser's localStorage and our database.

Cookies and localStorage data: we use browser localStorage to store your authentication token and session data. No cookies are set by our application. You can clear this data at any time through your browser settings. See Section 6 for details.
Payment data (if applicable): processed via third-party payment processors; we do not store full card details.

section3.title: 3. Purpose and Legal Basis for Processing
section3.content: The processing purposes and corresponding legal bases are as follows:

tableRows.purpose: Operating, securing, and maintaining the App
Communicating with users and providing support
Compliance with legal and accounting obligations

section3.footer: We do not use your personal data for marketing, advertising, or profiling.

section4.title: 4. Use of AI Services
section4.content: Flow-XR uses publicly available artificial intelligence models (e.g., OpenAI or similar) to support the coaching process.
items: Responses are generated dynamically based on your input.
We do not control or modify how external AI services process that input.
Therefore, you should not share sensitive personal data (e.g., health, religion, political opinions, sexual orientation, or data about third parties such as your clients).
All AI communications are transmitted via encrypted channels.

section5.title: 5. Google OAuth Login
section5.content: The App uses Google OAuth to allow you to log in securely using your Google account. When you use this option:
section5.content2: We receive only basic profile information (your name and email) from Google to verify your identity.
items: Google may set its own cookies to manage authentication and session status.
These cookies are subject to Google's privacy policy, which you can review here: ðŸ”— Google Privacy Policy
section5.footer: We do not gain access to your Google password or any unrelated data from your Google account.

section6.title: 6. Use of Local Storage
section6.content: The App stores a limited set of data locally in your browser using localStorage, including:
items: auth_token â€“ to keep you logged in,
guest_user_id â€“ to track anonymous session progress.
section6.footer: These items are stored only in your browser, are not transmitted to our servers, and you can delete them at any time through your browser's settings or developer tools. They exist solely to enhance user experience and session continuity.

section7.title: 7. Data Sharing and International Transfers
section7.content: We share data only when necessary, and only with:
items: Service providers that support the operation of the Flow-XR application (e.g., hosting and authentication).
External AI providers (to generate AI-assisted responses).
section7.content2: Some partners may be based outside the European Economic Area (EEA). In such cases, we rely on Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or other safeguards ensuring adequate protection under GDPR.
section7.footer: We never sell or rent your personal data to third parties.

section8.title: 8. Data Retention
section8.content: Your personal data are kept only as long as necessary for the purposes described above:
items: Account data: retained while your account is active.
Session data: retained until you delete it or your account is removed.
OAuth data: stored only for account linking; removed upon account deletion.
Technical data and logs: retained for up to approximately 7 days.
Inactive accounts: may be deleted after 12 months of inactivity.
section8.footer: You may delete your account from your dashboard or request deletion of your account or session data at any time (see Section 10).

section9.title: 9. Data Security
section9.content: We apply technical and organizational safeguards to protect your data, including:
items: Encryption in transit (SSL/TLS),
Secure password hashing,
Limited employee access,
Regular security reviews and monitoring.
section9.content2: We continuously monitor our systems for vulnerabilities and regularly review our data protection practices to ensure compliance with the latest security standards.
section9.footer: While we strive to protect your data, no system is entirely invulnerable. Users are encouraged to use strong passwords and log out from shared devices.

section10.title: 10. Your Rights Under GDPR
section10.content: You have the following rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR):
items: Access: to obtain a copy of your personal data.
Rectification: to correct inaccurate or incomplete data.
Erasure: to request deletion ("right to be forgotten").
Restriction: to limit certain processing.
Portability: to receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format.
Objection: to processing based on legitimate interest.
Complaint: to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority (in Poland: President of the Personal Data Protection Office, ul. Stawki 2, 00-193 Warsaw, Poland).
section10.content2: To exercise your rights, please contact us at admin@flow-xr.com.

section11.title: 11. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section11.content: As stated in Sections 2 and 6, we do not use cookies. We rely on browser localStorage to store your authentication token and session data. You can clear this data at any time through your browser settings.

section12.title: 12. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section12.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. The updated version will be posted on this page with a revised "Last updated" date. If changes are significant, we will notify you by email or within the App before they take effect.

section13.title: 13. Contact Information
section13.content: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests related to this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

section14.title: 14. Summary for Users
items: Your data are used only to provide and improve your coaching experience.
We use Google OAuth for secure login and localStorage to store minimal session data on your device.
We do not sell, profile, or share your personal information beyond what is necessary to run the App.
Please avoid entering sensitive data during AI-assisted sessions, as they use public AI models.
